item.title: Analysing a Decade of Github Stars
item.description: I assembled and analysed a decade of timestamped Github stars, in order to retrospectively analyse large IT trends. Stars are a rough proxy for popularity of a repository. Like any proxy measure, it is flawed. But it’s sufficient for a rough trend analysis. An additional caveat is that tech represented on Github is a non-representative subset of IT tech overall. The Data I downloaded timestamped Github stars for each repository with more than 4k stars, corresponding to the top 5k repositories ordered by star count on 2020-06-07.
